usageEnvironment.detectionEvidence: Script uses `Element el = getElement()` and interacts with element zones (`el.zone(0)`), beams, and bodies. It creates physical `Sheet` objects using `dbCreate()` which modifies the 3D model. It uses `Display` objects for visualization, but does not contain ShopDrawing (`sd_*`) functions or `_Viewport` logic.

prerequisites.requiredSpace: Model Space (Must be inserted/assigned to an Element)

{
  "scriptPurpose": {
    "summary": "Generates 3D insulation sheets within timber frame walls, automatically cutting them to fit around studs and openings, and calculating material quantities for procurement.",
    "category": "Envelope/Finishing",
    "typicalUseCase": "Automatically filling the void between studs in an external wall with mineral wool or rigid foam insulation, ensuring the pieces are sized for installation and reporting required stock lengths."
  },
  "parameters": [
    {
      "name": "sExternalWalls",
      "technicalDefault": "\"EA;EB;\"",
      "businessMeaning": "A filter list determining which specific wall types (Element Codes) the insulation should be applied to. Only elements matching these codes will process the insulation.",
      "validRange": "Semi-colon separated list of Element Codes (e.g., 'EA;EB;IC;')",
      "unit": "text",
      "affectsOutput": "Determines if the script executes geometry generation for a given element."
    },
    {
      "name": "sName1",
      "technicalDefault": "\"Crown FrameTherm Roll 40\"",
      "businessMeaning": "The specific trade name or product code of the primary insulation material used for the main body of the wall.",
      "validRange": "Pre-defined manufacturer list or 'Other Insulation Type'",
      "unit": "text",
      "affectsOutput": "Sets the Sheet Name and Material attribute in the model and BOM reports."
    },
    {
      "name": "sExtraName1",
      "technicalDefault": "\"\"",
      "businessMeaning": "Custom product name used only if 'Other Insulation Type' is selected in the primary name field.",
      "validRange": "Any text string",
      "unit": "text",
      "affectsOutput": "Overrides the Sheet Name in the model and BOM if 'Other' is selected."
    },
    {
      "name": "nZones",
      "technicalDefault": "10",
      "businessMeaning": "Selects the specific construction layer (Zone) within the wall to fill with insulation. Maps user selections (1-10, 0) to internal element zones (e.g., 10 maps to Zone -5).",
      "validRange": "1 to 10, or 0",
      "unit": "count",
      "affectsOutput": "Determines the depth/location in the wall where insulation sheets are generated."
    },
    {
      "name": "dThick1",
      "technicalDefault": "90 mm",
      "businessMeaning": "The thickness of the insulation batt. A value of 0 triggers an 'Auto-fit' mode, where thickness is calculated to exactly match the depth of the wall frame (Zone 0).",
      "validRange": "0 (Auto) to 300 mm",
      "unit": "mm",
      "affectsOutput": "Sets the Z-depth of the generated 3D Sheets."
    },
    {
      "name": "dStockWidth1",
      "technicalDefault": "1200 mm",
      "businessMeaning": "The standard width of the raw material as purchased from the supplier (e.g., a standard roll width). Used to calculate how many linear meters or units are required.",
      "validRange": "400 mm to 1200 mm (Standard industry widths)",
      "unit": "mm",
      "affectsOutput": "Affects the calculated quantity and waste factors in BOM/ElemItem reports."
    },
    {
      "name": "dStockLength1",
      "technicalDefault": "8000 mm",
      "businessMeaning": "The standard length of the raw material bundle or roll.",
      "validRange": "3000 mm to 12000 mm",
      "unit": "mm",
      "affectsOutput": "Used for optimization calculations and reporting total units needed."
    },
    {
      "name": "sInsulationUnits1",
      "technicalDefault": "\"Rolls\"",
      "businessMeaning": "The unit of measure for procurement and labeling (e.g., buying Rolls vs buying Slabs).",
      "validRange": "Rolls, Slabs, Batts, Boards",
      "unit": "enum",
      "affectsOutput": "Text label in reports and data export."
    },
    {
      "name": "sName2",
      "technicalDefault": "\"Crown FrameTherm Roll 40\"",
      "businessMeaning": "Material name for insulation used specifically in connection areas or junctions (e.g., around windows or wall corners) where a different product might be required (e.g., acoustic insulation).",
      "validRange": "Pre-defined manufacturer list or 'Other Insulation Type'",
      "unit": "text",
      "affectsOutput": "Sets the Sheet Name for 'special' connection areas."
    },
    {
      "name": "dThick2",
      "technicalDefault": "90 mm",
      "businessMeaning": "Thickness of the insulation material used specifically in connection areas.",
      "validRange": "0 to 300 mm",
      "unit": "mm",
      "affectsOutput": "Sets the Z-depth of insulation sheets in connection/junction zones."
    },
    {
      "name": "dMinWidth",
      "technicalDefault": "20 mm",
      "businessMeaning": "Scrap filter. Any generated insulation piece with a width smaller than this value is discarded to prevent creating unmanufacturable slivers.",
      "validRange": "10 mm to 100 mm",
      "unit": "mm",
      "affectsOutput": "Reduces the number of generated sheets by filtering out small fragments."
    },
    {
      "name": "dWDecrease",
      "technicalDefault": "0",
      "businessMeaning": "Horizontal clearance/friction fit allowance. Reduces the width of the insulation polygon to ensure it fits easily between studs without bulging.",
      "validRange": "0 mm to 10 mm",
      "unit": "mm",
      "affectsOutput": "Shrinks the generated Sheet polygons along the wall X-axis."
    },
    {
      "name": "dHDecrease",
      "technicalDefault": "0",
      "businessMeaning": "Vertical clearance/friction fit allowance. Reduces the height of the insulation polygon.",
      "validRange": "0 mm to 10 mm",
      "unit": "mm",
      "affectsOutput": "Shrinks the generated Sheet polygons along the wall Y-axis."
    },
    {
      "name": "sStopInsulationAtFlatStud",
      "technicalDefault": "No",
      "businessMeaning": "Control to prevent insulation from overlapping flat studs (dwangs/noggins) that do not span the full wall thickness.",
      "validRange": "Yes, No",
      "unit": "bool",
      "affectsOutput": "Modifies the geometry generation logic to exclude areas obstructed by flat studs in connection zones."
    }
  ],
  "parameterDependencies": [
    {

workflowDiagram: 2. Validate Insertion Cycle: If cycle count > 1, erase instance and exit (prevents duplicate execution)
3. Retrieve Current Element: Get the element the script is attached to
4. Filter Element Type: Check if Element Code matches any code listed in 'sExternalWalls'
5. Determine Target Zone: Map user selection 'nZones' (1-10, 0) to actual Element Zone (e.g., 10 -> -5)
6. Extract Geometry: Gather all beams from the element and filter them by relevance (location/zone)
7. Calculate Insulation Contours: Generate base polygons by subtracting beam cross-sections from the wall outline (Zone 0)
8. Identify Connection Areas: Analyze geometry to determine if specific insulation areas are 'Special' (e.g., around corners/openings) based on top plate interference
9. Apply Reductions: Shrink all polygon contours by 'dWDecrease' (width) and 'dHDecrease' (height)
10. Cleanup Previous Data: Erase existing insulation Sheets in the target zone that are marked with the specific MapX identifier
a. Validate Size: Discard if width or height is smaller than 'dMinWidth'
b. Determine Logic Path: Is the area marked as a 'Special' Connection?
i. [Path A - Connection]: Check 'sStopInsulationAtFlatStud'. If Yes, skip creation. Check available depth against Top Plate.
ii. [Path B - Standard]: Use standard settings.
c. Determine Thickness: Check if 'dThick1' (or 'dThick2' for connections) is 0 (Auto) or fixed value
12. Create Geometry: Generate 3D Sheet entities, assign Material/Name, and set MapX for future cleanup
13. Generate 2D Display: Create Hatch patterns and Dimension text based on view settings ('sDispRep')
14. Export Production Data: Create ElemItem entries for BOM reports (Material, Stock Sizes, Units)

path1.name: Fixed Thickness
steps: Apply specified thickness to the generated Sheet

path2.name: Auto Thickness (0)
steps: Calculate thickness based on Element Zone 0 depth ('el.zone(0).dH()')
Apply calculated thickness to the generated Sheet

path1.name: Standard Wall Area
steps: Ignore Top Plate interference checks for placement

path2.name: Connection/Special Area
steps: If Stop is Yes, skip creating sheet if flat stud interference detected
Check available space against Top Plate profile ('ppRotateTop')

validationRules.recovery: Add the Element Code to the 'sExternalWalls' property list (e.g., 'EA;EB;')
Reduce the 'dMinWidth' property value to allow smaller pieces, or adjust wall geometry to create larger cavities
Change 'sStopInsulationAtFlatStud' to 'No' to force creation, or modify wall framing to remove flat studs in the connection zone

postInsertionActions.effect: Changing properties (Thickness, Name, Reductions) triggers a recalc. Old sheets are erased (via MapX) and new sheets are generated instantly.
If the current element's code is removed from 'sExternalWalls', all insulation sheets generated by this script are deleted from the element.
Updating Hatch Pattern, Scale, Color, or Display Representation updates the 2D graphics without regenerating 3D geometry.

data.markdown:
# hsb_Insulation.mcr

## Overview
This script automatically generates 3D insulation sheets within timber frame walls based on specific wall types. It calculates material quantities, cuts insulation around studs and openings, and outputs data for production reports.

## Usage Environment
| Space | Supported | Notes |
|-------|-----------|-------|
| Model Space | Yes | This script generates 3D bodies and modifies the model. |
| Paper Space | No | Not applicable for layout views. |
| Shop Drawing | No | Does not generate 2D shop drawings directly. |

## Prerequisites
- **Required Entities**: An existing Wall Element (e.g., External Wall).
- **Minimum Beam Count**: 0 (Processes any beams present in the wall).
- **Required Settings**: None (All settings are managed via the Properties Panel).

## Usage Steps

### Step 1: Launch Script
Command: `TSLINSERT` â†’ Select `hsb_Insulation.mcr`

### Step 2: Assign to Element
```
Command Line: Select Element:
Action: Click on the wall element in the model where you want to generate insulation.
```

### Step 3: Configure Properties
```
Action: Select the inserted script instance (or the element if attached).
Open the Properties Palette (Ctrl+1).
Modify the "Wall types for this Insulation" to include the Element Code of the selected wall.
```
*Note: The script processes immediately once the properties match the element's code.*

## Properties Panel Parameters

| Parameter | Type | Default | Description |
|-----------|------|---------|-------------|
| Wall types for this Insulation | Text | EA;EB; | Defines which Element Codes (e.g., EA, EB) will have insulation generated. Separate codes with a semicolon (;). |
| Insulation Name | Dropdown | Crown FrameTherm Roll 40 | Select the manufacturer and product name for the main wall areas. |
| Other Insulation Type | Text | [Empty] | If "Other Insulation Type" is selected above, enter the custom name here. |
| Attach Insulation to Zone | Dropdown | 10 | Selects the construction layer (Zone) inside the wall to fill. Options 1-10 map to specific internal zones; 0 implies a specific default logic. |
| Insulation Thickness | Number | 90 mm | The thickness of the insulation batt. Set to `0` to automatically match the wall cavity depth. |
| Insulation Stock Width | Number | 1200 mm | The standard width of the raw material (e.g., roll width) used for quantity calculations. |
| Insulation Stock Length | Number | 8000 mm | The standard length of the raw material bundle or roll for optimization. |
| Insulation Stock Units | Dropdown | Rolls | The unit of measure for reports (Rolls, Slabs, Batts, Boards). |
| Insulation Name for Connections | Dropdown | Crown FrameTherm Roll 40 | The product name for insulation used specifically at junctions or connection areas. |
| Other Insulation Type (Conn) | Text | [Empty] | Custom name for connections if "Other" is selected. |
| Insulation Thickness (Conn) | Number | 90 mm | Thickness for insulation used in connection areas. |
| Minimum Width | Number | 20 mm | Scrap filter. Any piece narrower than this will not be created. |
| Width Decrease | Number | 0 | Horizontal allowance (friction fit). Reduces the sheet width to ensure easy fit between studs. |
| Height Decrease | Number | 0 | Vertical allowance (friction fit). Reduces the sheet height. |
| Stop Insulation at Flat Stud | Yes/No | No | If "Yes", prevents insulation from being generated where it interferes with flat studs (dwangs/noggins) in connection zones. |

## Right-Click Menu Options

| Menu Item | Description |
|-----------|-------------|
| Recalculate | Refreshes the insulation geometry based on current wall geometry and script properties. (Triggered automatically when properties change). |

## Settings Files
- **Filename**: None
- **Location**: N/A
- **Purpose**: All configuration is handled directly through the AutoCAD Properties Palette using the parameters listed above.

## Tips
- **Auto-Fit Thickness**: Set `Insulation Thickness` to `0` to let the script automatically calculate the exact depth of the wall cavity. This is useful if wall depths vary.
- **Friction Fit**: Use the `Width Decrease` and `Height Decrease` parameters (e.g., 5mm) to shrink the insulation slightly. This ensures the batts fit snugly between studs without bowing the wall.
- **Filtering**: To exclude specific walls, remove their Element Code from the `Wall types for this Insulation` list.
- **Connection Details**: If you use rigid foam for corners but wool for the general wall, configure the `Insulation Name` (General) and `Insulation Name for Connections` differently.

## FAQ
- **Q: I inserted the script, but no insulation appeared.**
  - A: Check the `Wall types for this Insulation` property. Ensure the Element Code of your wall (e.g., "EA") is listed in that string. It must match exactly (including semicolons).
- **Q: Why are there small gaps in my insulation?**
  - A: Check your `Width Decrease` and `Height Decrease` values. If they are set too high, the insulation will pull away from the studs. Set them to `0` for a perfect fill, or a small value (2-5mm) for friction fit.
- **Q: Insulation is missing around windows/doors.**
  - A: This may be controlled by the `Stop Insulation at Flat Stud` setting or the logic for connection zones. Try switching `Stop Insulation at Flat Stud` to "No".
